'''Lučenec District''' (''okres Lučenec'') is a [[district]] in the [[Banská Bystrica Region]] of south-central [[Slovakia]]. Until 1918, most of the district belong to the [[Nógrád (former county)|Novohrad]] county, with a small area around the villages of [[Šíd]], [[Čamovce]] and [[Šurice]] in the east belonging to the [[Gömör-Kishont|Gemer a Malohont]] county.
The district is situated in the [[Southern Slovak Basin]], in the broad valley of the [[Ipeľ River]]. The two towns—[[Lučenec]] and [[Fiľakovo]]—comprise nearly 54% of the population of the district, the remainder living in the 55 surrounding villages.
The district lies on the [[European route E571|E571]] route (Route 50 in Slovak numbering) from [[Bratislava]] to [[Košice]], and on one of the train lines connecting the two cities. Train services also run to [[Budapest]] via Fiľakovo. There is a small aerodrome at [[Boľkovce]].
The main industries are food processing and building materials.
